sn35.97:4.1: “Mendicants, I will teach you who lives negligently and who lives diligently.
sn35.97:4.3: And how does someone live negligently?
sn35.97:4.4: When you live with the eye faculty unrestrained, your mind becomes polluted
sn35.97:4.5: when it comes to sights cognizable by the eye. When the mind is polluted, there’s no gladness.
sn35.97:4.6: When there’s no gladness, there’s no rapture.
sn35.97:4.7: When there’s no rapture, there’s no tranquility.
sn35.97:4.8: When there’s no tranquility, there’s suffering.
sn35.97:4.9: The mind that suffers doesn’t come together in samādhi.
sn35.97:4.10: When the mind has no samādhi, principles do not become clear.
sn35.97:4.11: Because principles have not become clear, you’re considered to live negligently.
sn35.97:4.12: When you live with the ear … nose … tongue … body …
sn35.97:4.14: mind faculty unrestrained, your mind becomes polluted when it comes to phenomena cognizable by the mind. When the mind is polluted, there’s no gladness.
sn35.97:4.15: When there’s no gladness, there’s no rapture.
sn35.97:4.16: When there’s no rapture, there’s no tranquility.
sn35.97:4.17: When there’s no tranquility, there’s suffering.
sn35.97:4.18: The mind that suffers doesn’t come together in samādhi.
sn35.97:4.19: When the mind has no samādhi, principles do not become clear.
sn35.97:4.20: Because principles have not become clear, you’re considered to live negligently.
sn35.97:5.1: And how does someone live diligently?
sn35.97:5.2: When you live with the eye faculty restrained, your mind doesn’t become polluted when it comes to sights cognizable by the eye. When the mind isn’t polluted, gladness springs up.
sn35.97:5.4: When the mind is full of rapture, the body becomes tranquil.
sn35.97:5.5: When the body is tranquil, one feels bliss.
sn35.97:5.6: And when blissful, the mind comes together in samādhi.
sn35.97:5.7: When the mind has samādhi, principles become clear.
sn35.97:5.8: Because principles have become clear, you’re considered to live diligently. …
